TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit CmsSigner extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a potential signer for a CMS/PKCS#7 signed message.
Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor results in the following default property values:
|Property|Default value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.SignerIdentifierType%2A>|<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType.IssuerAndSerialNumber?displayProperty=nameWithType>| |<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.DigestAlgorithm%2A>|2.16.840.1.101.3.4.2.1 (SHA-256)| |<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.IncludeOption%2A>|<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509IncludeOption.ExcludeRoot?displayProperty=nameWithType>|

Docs.param: The CSP parameters to describe which signing key to use.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a persisted key.

## Remarks This constructor results in the following default property values:
|Property|Default value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.SignerIdentifierType%2A>|<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType.SubjectKeyIdentifier?displayProperty=nameWithType>| |<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.DigestAlgorithm%2A>|2.16.840.1.101.3.4.2.1 (SHA-256)| |<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.IncludeOption%2A>|<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509IncludeOption.None?displayProperty=nameWithType>|
> [!IMPORTANT] > This method is only supported on .NET Framework. Its use on .NET Core throws a <xref:System.PlatformNotSupportedException>.

Docs.exception: .NET Core only: This member is not supported.

Docs.param: The certificate whose private key will be used to sign a message.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified signer certificate.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor results in the following default property values:
|Property|Default value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.SignerIdentifierType%2A>|<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType.IssuerAndSerialNumber?displayProperty=nameWithType>| |<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.DigestAlgorithm%2A>|2.16.840.1.101.3.4.2.1 (SHA-256)| |<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.IncludeOption%2A>|<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509IncludeOption.ExcludeRoot?displayProperty=nameWithType>|
The signing certificate specified by the `certificate` parameter is not checked for validity on input. To validate the certificate prior to supplying it to this constructor, use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Chain.Build%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType signerIdentifierType, class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 certificate, class System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm privateKey) cil managed
Public Sub New (signerIdentifierType As SubjectIdentifierType, certificate As X509Certificate2, privateKey As AsymmetricAlgorithm)

Docs.param: One of the enumeration values that specifies the scheme to use for identifying which signing certificate was used.
The certificate whose private key will be used to sign a message.
The private key object to use when signing the message.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified signer certificate, subject identifier type, and private key object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor results in the following default property values: |Property|Default value| |--------------|-------------------| ||2.16.840.1.101.3.4.2.1 (SHA-256)| || if is ,

otherwise| The signing certificate specified by the `certificate` parameter is not checked for validity on input. To validate the certificate prior to supplying it to this constructor, use the method. This constructor does not validate that the `privateKey` parameter corresponds to the public key in `certificate`. If the keys don't match, the class and method throw a during the signing process.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::X509Certificate2 ^ Certificate { System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::X509Certificate2 ^ get(); void set(System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::X509Certificate2 ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property sets or retrieves the object that represents the signing certificate.
Docs.value: An object that represents the signing certificate.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::X509Certificate2Collection ^ Certificates { System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::X509Certificate2Collection ^ get(); void set(System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::X509Certificate2Collection ^ value); };
Public ReadOnly Property Certificates As X509Certificate2Collection

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of certificates which are considered with and .
Docs.value: A collection of certificates which are considered with and .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The certificates in this collection are provided to <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Chain> via <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ChainPolicy.ExtraStore?displayProperty=nameWithType> when the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.IncludeOption> indicates that more than one certificate should be included. Any certificate which is part of this collection that is not relevant to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.IncludeOption> value is ignored.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Security::Cryptography::Oid ^ DigestAlgorithm { System::Security::Cryptography::Oid ^ get(); void set(System::Security::Cryptography::Oid ^ value); };
member this.DigestAlgorithm : System.Security.Cryptography.Oid with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the algorithm identifier for the hash algorithm to use with the signature.
Docs.value: The algorithm identifier for the hash algorithm to use with the signature.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For the default value of this property, see <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.%23ctor>.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::X509IncludeOption IncludeOption { System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::X509IncludeOption get(); void set(System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::X509IncludeOption value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the option indicating how much of a the signer certificate's certificate chain should be embedded in the signed message.
Docs.value: One of the enumeration values that indicates how much of a the signer certificate's certificate chain should be embedded in the signed message.
Docs.exception: One of the arguments provided to a method was not valid.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Security::Cryptography::AsymmetricAlgorithm ^ PrivateKey { System::Security::Cryptography::AsymmetricAlgorithm ^ get(); void set(System::Security::Cryptography::AsymmetricAlgorithm ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the private key object to use during signing.
Docs.value: The private key to use during signing, or to use the private key associated with the property.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Security::Cryptography::CryptographicAttributeObjectCollection ^ SignedAttributes { System::Security::Cryptography::CryptographicAttributeObjectCollection ^ get(); void set(System::Security::Cryptography::CryptographicAttributeObjectCollection ^ value); };
Public ReadOnly Property SignedAttributes As CryptographicAttributeObjectCollection

Docs.summary: Gets a collections of attributes to associate with this signature that are also protected by the signature.
Docs.value: A collections of attributes to associate with this signature that are also protected by the signature.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An example of a signed attribute that might be included in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicAttributeObjectCollection> collection retrieved by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.SignedAttributes%2A> property is the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.Pkcs9SigningTime> signing time attribute.
A <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.Pkcs9ContentType> object and a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.Pkcs9MessageDigest> object will be automatically generated and placed in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SignerInfo.SignedAttributes%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property for the corresponding signer whenever the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.SignedAttributes%2A> property is not empty.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Security::Cryptography::Pkcs::SubjectIdentifierType SignerIdentifierType { System::Security::Cryptography::Pkcs::SubjectIdentifierType get(); void set(System::Security::Cryptography::Pkcs::SubjectIdentifierType value); };

Docs.summary: Gets the scheme to use for identifying which signing certificate was used.
Docs.value: The scheme to use for identifying which recipient certificate was used.
Docs.exception: One of the arguments provided to a method was not valid.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Security::Cryptography::CryptographicAttributeObjectCollection ^ UnsignedAttributes { System::Security::Cryptography::CryptographicAttributeObjectCollection ^ get(); void set(System::Security::Cryptography::CryptographicAttributeObjectCollection ^ value); };
Public ReadOnly Property UnsignedAttributes As CryptographicAttributeObjectCollection

Docs.summary: Gets a collections of attributes to associate with this signature that are not protected by the signature.
Docs.value: A collections of attributes to associate with this signature that are not protected by the signature.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An example of an unsigned attribute that might be included in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicAttributeObjectCollection> collection retrieved by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner.UnsignedAttributes%2A> property is a countersignature.
